title: Marmot unleashes an ear-piercing scream to the surprise of Blackcomb Mountain hikers
text:
16 shares 3
View
comments
This is the hilarious moment a group of tourists accidentally discovered one of the great mysteries of the world - the sound made by a marmot.
The hikers came across the little creature standing on a wooden fence while visiting Blackcomb Mountain, in British Colombia, Canada.
The group decided to film the rodent and after taking up a safe position, zoomed in on it and waited patiently for something to happen.
At first the marmot merely stood still (left) until it decided to break the silence and started screaming at the top of its lungs (right)
But at first the marmot merely stands still - the only movement comes from its little chest, which beats gently but at a rapid pace.
The camera does pick up the astonishing backdrop behind the creature however - a landscape view that resembles a postcard.

Share this article Share 16 shares Suddenly the creature decides to break its silence and after one last breath opens its mouth as far as it can go and screams at the top of its lungs.
The sound is reminiscent of a small child screeching in terror, and the rodent also wears a look of fear on its face.
As quickly as the noise was created, the marmot stops screaming and stands in its initial position as if nothing ever happened.
The sound was reminiscent of a small child screeching in terror, and the rodent looked to be in fear
The video maker laughs suddenly and the rodent looks towards the camera as if to say 'what's funny?'
The marmot then decides to scream again and while doing so looks forward slightly before staring back at the filmmaker.
The video concludes with the creature falling silent once again and looking off into the distance in a rather pensive manner.
This is not the first time an animal has stunned a group of tourists by making a bizarre sound.
In July of this year, a deer made a noise like a squeaky door before letting out a truly sinister scream for tourists to Japan
